dosing.text: 40 mg by subcutaneous injection every other week.
Alternative: 40 mg by subcutaneous injection every week in patients not concurrently taking methotrexate.

dosing.text: 10 kg (22 lbs) to <15 kg (33 lbs): Inject 10 mg subcutaneously every other week.
15 kg (33 lbs) to <30 kg (66 lbs): Inject 20 mg subcutaneously every other week.
≥30 kg (66 lbs): Inject 40 mg subcutaneously every other week.

dosing.text: Initial Dose: Inject 80 mg subcutaneously.
Maintenance Dose: Inject 40 mg subcutaneously every other week starting one week after initial dose.

treatmentLine.selectedListName: Inflammatory Bowel Agent - Aminosalicylates and Related Agents
Antipsoriatic Agents - MC Antibody, Human Interleukin 12/23 Inhibitors

dosing.text: Initial dose (Day 1): Inject 160 mg subcutaneously (four 40 mg injections in one day or two 40 mg injections per day for two consecutive days).
Second dose two weeks later (Day 15): Inject 80 mg subcutaneously.
Two weeks later (Day 29): Begin a maintenance dose of 40 mg injected subcutaneously every other week.

instructions.instruction: For patients with Ulcerative Colitis only: Only continue HUMIRA in patients who have shown evidence of clinical remission by eight weeks (Day 57) of therapy.

qlimit.initPerIntervalDesc: 1 starter pack for the first 28 days only
6 pens per 28 days for the first 4 weeks, then 2 pens per 28 days thereafter
6 kits per 28 days for the first 4 weeks, then 2 kits per 28 days thereafter

references.reference: Humira [package insert]. North Chicago, IL: AbbVie Inc; 2014

Kornbluth A, Sachar DB. Erratum: Ulcerative Colitis Practice Guidelines in Adults: American College of Gastroenterology, Practice Parameters Committee. Am J Gastroenterol 2010; 105: 501–23; doi:10.1038/ajg.2009.727

Kornbluth A, Sachar DB. Ulcerative Colitis Practice Guidelines in Adults (Update)" American College of Gastroenterology, Practice Parameters Committe. Am J Gastroenterol 2004; 99: 1371–85; doi:10.1111/j.1572-0241.2004.40036.x

treatmentLine.selectedListName: Crohn's disease - aminosalicylates and related agents
Antipsoriatic Agents - MC Antibody, Human Interleukin 12/23 Inhibitors

dosing.text: Initial dose (Day 1): 160 mg (four 40 mg injections in one day or two 40 mg injections per day for two consecutive days).
Second dose two weeks later (Day 15): 80 mg
Two weeks later (Day 29): Begin a maintenance dose of 40 mg every other week.
Note: Some patients may require a maintenance dose of 40 mg every week

qlimit.initPerIntervalDesc: 1 starter pack for the first 28 days only

dosing.text: 17 kg (37 lbs) to < 40 kg (88 lbs), initial dose: 80 mg (two 40 mg injections in one day)
17 kg (37 lbs) to < 40 kg (88 lbs), second dose two weeks later (Day 15): 40 mg
17 kg (37 lbs) to < 40 kg (88 lbs), maintence dose two weeks later (Day 29): 20 mg every other week.
≥ 40 kg (88 lbs), initial dose: 160 mg (four 40 mg injections in one day or two 40 mg injections per day for two consecutive days)
≥ 40 kg (88 lbs), second dose two weeks later (Day 15): 80 mg (two 40 mg injections in one day)
≥ 40 kg (88 lbs), maintence dose two weeks later (Day 29): 40 mg every other week.

2 kits per 28 days

dosing.text: Inject 40 mg subcutaneously every other week.
Note: Doses may be increased to once weekly during periods of relapse and may be maintained until inflammation is controlled.
